item.title: General rubbish, 14th October
item.description:
Rubbish bag has been torn apart so there is now mouldy food which is attracting flies etc. There is broken glass bottles which is dangerous for dogs and other wildlife. There is a broken chair and a child's walker. These have been here for at least two months, if not longer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Shoreham Road, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Extreme and reoccurring litter spilling, 14th October
item.description:
The corner of that street is constantly fouled, dirty, and full of over spilled litter and house waste. The refuse area is poorly maintained, either by residents of the building nearby or by waste collection men. Attracts rodents and foxes. Poor hygiene.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tudor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Immediate action required!— littering at Anglesea Avenue, 14th October
item.description:
There is persistent littering at Anglesea Avenue creating a health and safety nuisance for local residents. Please confirm within 7 days what action you will take to clear the littering. If I do not receive a substantive response, I will escalate this to the council’s formal complaints procedure, my local councillor, the Local Government Ombudsman, and local press.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anglesea Mews, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household rubbish and broken barriers, 14th October
item.description:
Bags of household rubbish left and now strewn across the street. A number of plastic barriers have also been abandoned after public highway works and are blocking the pavement and storm drain.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millfields Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Excessive Traffic caused by Temporary traffic lights, 14th October
item.description:
Temporary traffic lights causing severe delays and backlog of congestion all the way to Rotherhithe with no signs of men at work. This leads to people waiting in a traffic jam over an hour which is so unnecessary. We cannot come out of our side roads because of the blockage. There are no workmen at night nor during the day. Why are they there? They also cause so much delay for bus drivers in transporting people. With the road restrictions due to cycle lane installed makes it very difficult to have a good flow of traffic at all times. It just does not make any sense to have a 3 to 4 way Temporary traffic light system with no works being undertaken. This not only affects the main one way system all around Surrey quays but up to Rotherhithe and in addition, the side roads.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evelyn Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of waste, 14th October
item.description:
Several bin bags full of waste. I reported this 2 weeks ago and they were covered in Hackney Council tape but never removed. I received an email saying that the problem had been resolved but it wasn’t. Now they are attracting more rubbish.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Casimir Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
